name: A Challenge for Geniuses Quiz | Mixed 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.text: What kind of object is a Zabaglione?
questions.explanation:
Italian dessert.

	This dish includes egg yolks, sugar and Marsala wine, all whipped together.  It in no way resembles a Zamboni machine!

sikh.

	The Sikh religion is practiced by people who live in the Punjab regions of India and Pakistan.

questions.text: Besides Adonis, who else in Greek mythology was castrated for consorting with Aphrodite?
questions.explanation:
Anchises.

	Aphrodite, the Greek goddess of love, was certainly not easily attained, especially for mortal men like Adonis and Anchises.

questions.text: What is an ion called if it is carrying a positive and negative charge?
questions.explanation:
zwitterion.

	This term comes from the German words 'Zwitter', meaning 'hybrid', and 'Ion' (ion).

questions.text: What is a shard of glass intended for recycling called?
questions.explanation:
cullet.

	It's also spelled 'collet', from the Latin 'collum', the diminutive of 'col' (neck).

questions.text: What is the case called for carrying cricket equipment?
questions.explanation:
coffin.

	As you well know, a coffin also carries a dead body.  The term is from the Latin 'cophinus' (a little basket).

questions.text: What is a sand-covered surface called which transmits acoustic waves, so that the fillings of it creates a distinctive vibration pattern?
questions.explanation:
Chladni.

	Chladni patterns were discovered by German physicist Ernst Chladni, who lived during the 19th century.

questions.text: Which Roman emperor was reigning during the completion of the Roman colosseum?
questions.explanation:
Titus.

	During Titus' short reign, which lasted from 79-81 A.D., the famous eruption of Mt. Vesuvius that buried the city of Pompeii occurred.

questions.text: What is the Pali word for greed, desire, and thirst?
questions.explanation:
tanha.

	'Tanha' is another term for 'craving'.  It represents the Second Noble Truth of Buddhism, that 'tanha' is suffering.  Pali was the ancient language used in early Buddhist writings.

questions.text: What artist coined the term 'Abstract Expressionism'?
questions.explanation:
Kandinksy.

	Kandinsky wasn't an official member of the movement, having come well before its founding, but he was the earliest practioner of purely abstract art.  Members of the 'Ab Ex' movement included de Kooning and Jackson Pollock.  I hope you enjoyed this quiz and will try more of my stuff!
